title: Flipped Learning-Based Intensive Elementary Mathematics Course

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Short-term intensive courses operated as part of adult elementary education programs in vocational training institutions, utilizing blended learning environments with digital devices (tablets/laptops)

learning_goals: Learners can explain basic fraction concepts (equal partitioning, comparison) with ≥80% accuracy in a flipped learning environment
Learners can apply multi-stage problem-solving strategies by integrating online pre-learning videos with real-time class activities
By conducting ≥3 formative assessments by course completion, learners can improve mathematics concept retention rates from 70% to 85%
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
